content.webTitle: Laura Davis: ‘I once broke up a fight while wearing a penguin-head beanie’

fields.headline: Laura Davis: ‘I once broke up a fight while wearing a penguin-head beanie’
fields.bodyText: The funniest TV show I’ve ever seen … Northern Exposure. It’s so quirky and dark and surreal and human. The funniest person I know … My friend’s five-year-old daughter Beatrix. She’s a true master of cutting lines, wild impressions and surrealist improvisation. I hope she never grows out of it. The funniest heckle I’ve ever had … Once during the Perth fringe festival, no less than seven people had to be taken out of my show by security because they wouldn’t stop yelling “Cats ARE furry” at me. They were extremely drunk and misheard a joke I’d said. The funniest item of clothing I’ve ever owned … I once broke up a fight on the street while wearing a penguin-head beanie. I’m not particularly tall, so the penguin’s face was more at eye level with the drunk guy than I was. The funniest meal I’ve ever eaten … Those chicken nuggets that are shaped to look like dinosaurs. Chickens evolved from dinosaurs, and now humans are trying to mash them back into dinosaurs. The funniest hairstyle I’ve ever had … The time an apprentice hairdresser stuffed up my fringe and I looked like I’d had a frontal lobotomy. I tried to pass it off as retro, but it turns out there’s not a lot of nostalgia left for the early 1900s. The funniest thing that shouldn’t be funny … Probably that we’re all going to die. Everyone, everything. Hideous and hilarious all at once. Laura Davis plays Soho Theatre: Upstairs, W1, Thursday 20 to 22 June
